instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.D7701: What is D7701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT? PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the backlight on the LCD screen, this is necessary to get the screen to light up..
definitions.LCDBKLT_BOOST: What is LCDBKLT_BOOST? LCDBKLT_BOOST is connected to the SWITCH(SW) pin of the LED driver and is switched to ground quickly after the inductor in the DC to DC boost circuit that boosts PPBUS_G3H to backlight voltage for the screen. .
definitions.BKLT_EN: What is BKLT_EN? This signal enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKLT” before “_EN”. “BKLT” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont wake up after sleep.
threads.message:
hello, 
all work fine until i close the screen, when i open it its black screen but the keyboard light and CapsLock on, and after few second its power off.
i was put the board in full working body(to check if its from one of the parts) but the same.
so its board issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont wake up after sleep.
threads.message:
Did you also change LIO board/flex?
Possible issue with <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signal.
Be sure to check with original Magsafe 2 charger.

threads.message:
i was put just the board on different full body so yes, also good LIO.
i will check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> line.
also with just battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont wake up after sleep.
threads.message:
You need to work with board alone on the desk.
Use a magnet to simulate close lid.
Check <SIGNAL>BKLT_EN</SIGNAL>/PWM.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont wake up after sleep.
threads.message:
i dont think it backlight problem, the apple logo light on the back is on when i wake it up, also you can see that the backlight is on.
i notice that sometimes after 20-40sec is turn on suddenly but not all the time.
can be BIOS problem?

" after sleep they drain slowly to 0v
---------------
after 1-2min they both 7.5v but no screen"
Backlight requires 25V on <DIODE>D7701</DIODE> cathode...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont wake up after sleep.
threads.message: Pins 14 & 18 of J8300 maintain voltage after these 15-20s?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont wake up after sleep.
threads.message:
YES.
just <DIODE>D7701</DIODE> down from 25v to 7.5v until im pressing some key on keyboard.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont wake up after sleep.
threads.message:
If <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> remains high, the LCD is detected and PCH should maintain image and backlight enabled.

If you still get 7.5V at <DIODE>D7701</DIODE>, backlight is also enabled, but <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> doesn't boost, for some reason.
Change <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> and inspect its traces and surrounding components and solders.

threads.message:
not working, i think it something with the wakeup EN on the board..what is that line? :rolleyes:

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> wont wake up after sleep.
threads.message:
Inspect J9500 for corrosion.
Clean it anyway and check the solders.
